articles.title: Valve confirms that it has stopped making the Index VR headset
articles.description: In case you missed it, Valve announced a load of new hardware this week, including a second stab at the Steam Machine , a Steam controller, and a long-rumored new VR headset called the Steam Frame . But in with the new often means out with the old, and perhaps inevitably, the company has confirmed t
articles.content: In case you missed it, Valve announced a load of new hardware this week, including a second stab at the Steam Machine , a Steam controller, and a long-rumored new VR headset called the Steam Frame . But in with the new often means out with the old, and perhaps inevitably, the company has confirmed that its previous headset, the Valve Index, is no more. Valve‚Äôs Lawrence Yang told The Verge that it‚Äôs "no longer manufacturing" the Index, which we called "the best desktop VR yet" when it launched in
articles.author: Matt Tate

articles.title: Reproducible Dev Environments
articles.description: Modern projects need consistent, repeatable environments across developer machines, CI, and production. Discrepancies between development, testing, and production environments can lead to countless hours of debugging, configuration drift, and frustrating deployment failures. The core challenge is en
articles.content: Modern projects need consistent, repeatable environments across developer machines, CI, and production. Discrepancies between development, testing, and production environments can lead to countless hours of debugging, configuration drift, and frustrating deployment failures. The core challenge is ensuring that every developer, and every server, is working with the exact same set of tools, libraries, and dependencies. This post explains the ideas behind Nix and Flakes first, then shows how Devbox

articles.content: As engineers at GitHub, “dogfooding” is core to our culture. We build GitHub on GitHub, using the same tools we ship to developers. But as GitHub Copilot has evolved from an autocomplete suggestion to a sophisticated AI assistant, our own use of it has evolved, too. It’s no longer just a tool in our editors. articles.content: This is today’s edition of The Download , our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology.
